intro: Pulassarium stellatum, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Pulassarium stellatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
